elements.name: panel1
elements.title: The following statements on the subject of legal forms are not correct. Please correct them.

elements.name: question1
elements.title: At least three people are required to form a public limited company.

elements.name: question2
elements.title: Entry in the commercial register is always voluntary for sole proprietorships.
elements.correctAnswer: Entry is mandatory for annual turnover of CHF 100,000 or more.

elements.name: question3
elements.title: At least two people are required to found a cooperative.

elements.name: question11
elements.title: In a cooperative, the focus is on making a profit.

elements.name: question10
elements.title: The most important and highest body of the AG is the Board of Directors.
elements.correctAnswer: The highest body of the AG is the General Meeting.

elements.name: question9
elements.title: The company name of a sole proprietorship is freely selectable.
elements.correctAnswer: must consist of the owner's surname

elements.name: panel2
elements.title: The following statements on the subject of legal forms are not correct. Please correct them.

elements.name: question4
elements.title: When an AG is founded, the company only comes into existence when it is entered in the commercial register. The effect of the entry is therefore declaratory.

elements.name: question5
elements.title: Only financial resources can be contributed to the formation of a GmbH.

elements.name: question6
elements.title: In the case of a GmbH, the paid-up capital is called share capital and amounts to at least CHF 50,000.

elements.name: question7
elements.title: The partners of the general partnership are privately liable up to the amount of their capital share contributed to the company.
elements.correctAnswer: are liable without limitation and jointly and severally

elements.name: question8
elements.title: The members of the auditors are professionally qualified employees of the company.
elements.correctAnswer: The auditors must be independent of the company.

elements.name: question12
elements.title: There are two different groups of partners in a limited partnership: the general partners (full partners) and the limited partners (partial partners).

elements.name: panel3
elements.title: The following statements on the subject of legal forms are not correct. Please correct them.

elements.name: question13
elements.title: The Board of Directors of an AG approves the annual financial statements, the balance sheet and the income statement.

elements.name: question14
elements.title: A minimum share capital of CHF 100,000 and the cooperation of a judge are required to form an AG.

elements.name: question15
elements.title: The general partner works in the business. The limited partner focuses on personal participation.

elements.name: question16
elements.title: With the entry in the commercial register, company protection applies to all companies throughout Switzerland.
elements.correctAnswer: for sole proprietorship only at the place of HR entry

elements.name: question17
elements.title: Unlimited liability means that someone is not liable with their private assets.

elements.name: question18
elements.title: The GmbH and the sole proprietorship are liable exclusively with their business assets.
